Make instruments to plague us.
The dark and vicious place where thee he got
Cost him his eyes.

sp.speaker: EDMUND
sp.l: Th’ hast spoken right. ’Tis true.
The wheel is come full circle; I am here.

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: Methought thy very gait did prophesy
A royal nobleness. I must embrace thee.
Let sorrow split my heart if ever I
Did hate thee or thy father!

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: Worthy prince, I know ’t.

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: Where have you hid yourself?
How have you known the miseries of your father?

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: By nursing them, my lord. List a brief tale,
And when ’tis told, O, that my heart would burst!
The bloody proclamation to escape
That followed me so near— O, our lives’ sweetness,
That we the pain of death would hourly die
Rather than die at once!— taught me to shift
Into a madman’s rags, t’ assume a semblance
That very dogs disdained, and in this habit
Met I my father with his bleeding rings,
Their precious stones new lost; became his guide,
Led him, begged for him, saved him from despair.
Never— O fault!— revealed myself unto him
Until some half hour past, when I was armed.
Not sure, though hoping of this good success,
I asked his blessing, and from first to last
Told him our pilgrimage. But his flawed heart
( Alack, too weak the conflict to support)
’Twixt two extremes of passion, joy and grief,
Burst smilingly.

sp.speaker: EDMUND
sp.l: This speech of yours hath moved me,
And shall perchance do good. But speak you on.
You look as you had something more to say.

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: If there be more, more woeful, hold it in,
For I am almost ready to dissolve,
Hearing of this.

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: This would have seemed a period
To such as love not sorrow; but another,
To amplify too much, would make much more
And top extremity. Whilst I
Was big in clamor, came there in a man
Who, having seen me in my worst estate,
Shunned my abhorred society; but then, finding
Who ’twas that so endured, with his strong arms
He fastened on my neck and bellowed out
As he’d burst heaven, threw him on my father,
Told the most piteous tale of Lear and him
That ever ear received, which, in recounting,
His grief grew puissant, and the strings of life
Began to crack. Twice then the trumpets sounded,
And there I left him tranced.

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: But who was this?

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: Kent, sir, the banished Kent, who in disguise
Followed his enemy king and did him service
Improper for a slave.

div.stage: Enter a Gentleman with a bloody knife.

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.l: Help, help, O, help!

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: What kind of help?

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: Speak, man!

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: What means this bloody knife?

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.l: ’Tis hot, it smokes! It came even from the heart
Of— O, she’s dead!

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: Who dead? Speak, man.

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.l: Your lady, sir, your lady. And her sister
By her is poisoned. She confesses it.

sp.speaker: EDMUND
sp.l: I was contracted to them both. All three
Now marry in an instant.

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: Here comes Kent.

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: Produce the bodies, be they alive or dead.
This judgment of the heavens, that makes us tremble,
Touches us not with pity. O, is this he?
To Kent. The time will not allow the compliment
Which very manners urges.

sp.speaker: KENT
sp.l: I am come
To bid my king and master aye goodnight.
Is he not here?

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: Great thing of us forgot!
Speak, Edmund, where’s the King? And where’s Cordelia?
sp.stage: Goneril and Regan’s bodies brought out.
sp.l: Seest thou this object, Kent?

sp.speaker: KENT
sp.l: Alack, why thus?

sp.speaker: EDMUND
sp.l: Yet Edmund was beloved.
The one the other poisoned for my sake,
And after slew herself.

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: Even so.— Cover their faces.

sp.speaker: EDMUND
sp.l: I pant for life. Some good I mean to do
Despite of mine own nature. Quickly send—
Be brief in it— to th’ castle, for my writ
Is on the life of Lear, and on Cordelia.
Nay, send in time.

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: Run, run, O, run!

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: To who, my lord? To Edmund. Who has the office? Send
Thy token of reprieve.

sp.speaker: EDMUND
sp.l: Well thought on. Take my sword. Give it the Captain.

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: Haste thee for thy life.

div.stage: The Soldier exits with Edmund’s sword.

sp.speaker: EDMUND
sp.l: He hath commission from thy wife and me
To hang Cordelia in the prison, and
To lay the blame upon her own despair,
That she fordid herself.

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: The gods defend her!— Bear him hence awhile.

div.stage: Enter Lear with Cordelia in his arms, followed by a Gentleman.

sp.speaker: LEAR
sp.l: Howl, howl, howl! O, you are men of stones!
Had I your tongues and eyes, I’d use them so
That heaven’s vault should crack. She’s gone forever.
I know when one is dead and when one lives.
She’s dead as earth.— Lend me a looking glass.
If that her breath will mist or stain the stone,
Why, then she lives.

sp.speaker: KENT
sp.l: Is this the promised end?

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: Or image of that horror?

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: Fall and cease.

sp.speaker: LEAR
sp.l: This feather stirs. She lives. If it be so,
It is a chance which does redeem all sorrows
That ever I have felt.

sp.speaker: KENT
sp.l: O, my good master—

sp.speaker: LEAR
sp.l: Prithee, away.

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: ’Tis noble Kent, your friend.

sp.speaker: LEAR
sp.l: A plague upon you, murderers, traitors all!
I might have saved her. Now she’s gone forever.—
Cordelia, Cordelia, stay a little. Ha!
What is ’t thou sayst?— Her voice was ever soft,
Gentle, and low, an excellent thing in woman.
I killed the slave that was a-hanging thee.

sp.speaker: GENTLEMAN
sp.l: ’Tis true, my lords, he did.

sp.speaker: LEAR
sp.l: Did I not, fellow?
I have seen the day, with my good biting falchion
I would have made him skip. I am old now,
And these same crosses spoil me. To Kent. Who are you?
Mine eyes are not o’ th’ best. I’ll tell you straight.

sp.speaker: KENT
sp.l: If Fortune brag of two she loved and hated,
One of them we behold.

sp.speaker: LEAR
sp.l: This is a dull sight. Are you not Kent?

sp.speaker: KENT
sp.l: The same,
Your servant Kent. Where is your servant Caius?

sp.speaker: LEAR
sp.l: He’s a good fellow, I can tell you that.
He’ll strike and quickly too. He’s dead and rotten.

sp.speaker: KENT
sp.l: No, my good lord, I am the very man—

sp.speaker: LEAR
sp.l: I’ll see that straight.

sp.speaker: KENT
sp.l: That from your first of difference and decay
Have followed your sad steps.

sp.speaker: LEAR
sp.l: You are welcome hither.

sp.speaker: KENT
sp.l: Nor no man else. All’s cheerless, dark, and deadly.
Your eldest daughters have fordone themselves,
And desperately are dead.

sp.speaker: LEAR
sp.l: Ay, so I think.

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: He knows not what he says, and vain is it
That we present us to him.

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: Very bootless.

sp.speaker: MESSENGER
sp.l: Edmund is dead, my lord.

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: That’s but a trifle here.—
You lords and noble friends, know our intent:
What comfort to this great decay may come
Shall be applied. For us, we will resign,
During the life of this old Majesty,
To him our absolute power; you to your rights,
With boot and such addition as your Honors
Have more than merited. All friends shall taste
The wages of their virtue, and all foes
The cup of their deservings. O, see, see!

sp.speaker: LEAR
sp.l: And my poor fool is hanged. No, no, no life?
Why should a dog, a horse, a rat have life,
And thou no breath at all? Thou ’lt come no more,
Never, never, never, never, never.—
Pray you undo this button. Thank you, sir.
Do you see this? Look on her, look, her lips,
Look there, look there!

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: He faints. To Lear. My lord, my lord!

sp.speaker: KENT
sp.l: Break, heart, I prithee, break!

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: Look up, my lord.

sp.speaker: KENT
sp.l: Vex not his ghost. O, let him pass! He hates him
That would upon the rack of this tough world
Stretch him out longer.

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: He is gone indeed.

sp.speaker: KENT
sp.l: The wonder is he hath endured so long.
He but usurped his life.

sp.speaker: ALBANY
sp.l: Bear them from hence. Our present business
Is general woe. To Edgar and Kent. Friends of my soul, you twain
Rule in this realm, and the gored state sustain.

sp.speaker: KENT
sp.l: I have a journey, sir, shortly to go;
My master calls me. I must not say no.

sp.speaker: EDGAR
sp.l: The weight of this sad time we must obey,
Speak what we feel, not what we ought to say.
The oldest hath borne most; we that are young
Shall never see so much nor live so long.

div.stage: They exit with a dead march.
